description: Sent when a bank of Flash EPROM has been erased. If
lxswdisWriteStatus indicates success, then the unit is ready
to be downloaded with the new software.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'EPROM write status is success. Software downloaded is $v3' : 'EPROM write status is $v2'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxWriteStatusTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxswdisWriteStatus i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxswdisDesc s EXAMPLE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The status of the erase/write operation.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxswdisWriteStatus

description: The description (0-32 bytes) of the software set currently
being downloaded, or a description of the software set last
downloaded since the FN10-26 booted.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxswdisDesc

description: Sent whenever the current functional state (active
protocols) of the port has changed.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The current functional state (protocols which
have been activated and are operational) of the port. The
following values or combinations are supported:
0x0001 NMS, 0x0002 TBRIDGE, 0x0004 SBRIDGE
0x0006 SRTBRIDGE, 0x0008 MESH, 0x0010 IPROUTE
0x0020 NO_BPDU, 0x0040 RIP, 0x0080 SRSPAN
0x0100 PROXY, 0x0200 OSPF.
These values can be configured through the protoTable.
Combining TBRIDGE and SBRIDGE always produces SRTBRIDGE.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxifFunction

description: Sent whenever the number of times that the port's receiver
has stopped receiving packets due to buffer space shortages
has exceeded the port's limit.

event.Summary: Port receiver stopped receiving packets due to buffer space shortage

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Number of received packets lost because of
insufficient receive buffers. (For certain interfaces
with multi-packet FIFO hardware, this count might be
approximate.)
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxifRxQueues

description: Sent whenever multicast storm protection has been invoked
for the port.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Sent whenever packets destined for the unit itself were
discarded due to lack of buffer space.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Send whenever the unit has a debug text string to be
displayed. The text strings are sent in a stream-like
fashion.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxDebugStringIdTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxdebugStringID i 9999 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxdebugString s EXAMPLE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The number of debug text strings sent by the
ES-10. This parameter is used by the ES-10's enterprise
specific trap mechanism.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxdebugStringID

description: The last debug text string (0-80 bytes) sent
by the ES-10.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxdebugString

description: Send whenever the unit has finished a loop back test, or
a loop back error has been detected.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxLpbkOperationTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkOperation i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkErrorNoReceives c 9999 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkErrorBadReceives c 9999

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The type of loopback being performed. Setting
lxlpbkOperation to loopback-off causes loop back operation to
terminate. Setting lxlpbkOperation to loopback-local or
loopback-remote causes loopback operation to commence, and
the ES-10 automatically resets lpbkOperation to loopback-off
when the loopback operation has completed.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkOperation

description: The number of packets which were transmitted,
but not received. This number is automatically reset to
zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkErrorNoReceives

description: The number of transmitted packets which were
received with different data patterns. This number is
automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation
is initiated.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxlpbkErrorBadReceives

description: A trunking state change transition has occurred. The possible
transitions are:
CLOSED-ONEWAY
ONEWAY-PERTURBED
PERTURBED-JOINED
JOINED-HELDDOWN
CLOSED-HELDDOWN
ONEWAY-HELDDOWN
PERTURBED-HELDDOWN
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: If off(1) then this link has not been enabled for trunking.
If closed(2) then this link has not yet received any Trunking
PDUs. If oneway(3) then incoming Trunking PDUs do not indicate
that our PDUs are being successfully received by the far end.
If joined(4) then this link is actively participating in the
trunk group. If perturbed(5) then this link is actively
participating in the trunk group; however, the transmission
of data packets has been temporarily stopped due to a change
in membership of the group. If helddown(6) then an error has
been detected and the link is being held out-of-service until
the error clears. If broken(7) then this link has been
configured for trunking, but the port is physically
non-operational.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkState

description: The associated trunking MAC address of the bridge ID of the remote
bridge has changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxTrunkBridgeAddrTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkRemoteBridgeAddr s EXAMPLE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The MAC address portion of the bridge ID of the remote
bridge.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkRemoteBridgeAddr

description: The associated trunking IP address of the remote bridge has changed.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The IP address of the remote bridge, as reported by that
bridge for administrative purposes.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkRemoteIp

description: An error has occurred in trunking.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The last reason for failure when the link is in closed,
oneway, or helddown state.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkLastError

description: The port's index in the trunking group has changed.

event.Summary: Port index in the trunking group changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The position of this link within the trunk group.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkLinkOrdinal

description: The number of ports in the trunking group has changed.

event.Summary: Number of ports in the trunking group changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The number of links within the trunk group.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrunkLinkCount

description: The unit has booted. lxadminFatalErr contains information about
why the unit rebooted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxDiagUnitBootedTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxadminFatalErr s EXAMPLE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: This is a 32 byte array which contains information
about the cause of the previous system reset. This will
describe the circumstances which forced the system
software to perform a reboot. The values in the first
byte have the following meanings (0) Power failure, (1)
Watchdog Timeout, (2) NMS Requested Shutdown, (3-255)
Fatal Error (next byte contains the hwIndex of the module
which encountered the error; remaining 30 bytes contain
additional information).
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxadminFatalErr

description: Sent if the unit's Configuration EEPROM has failed. The unit
will not be able to reboot, and must be returned to the
factory.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Sent whenever outbound congestion control has been invoked
for the port.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen
to be discarded even though no errors had been
detected to prevent their being transmitted. One
possible reason for discarding such a packet could
be to free up buffer space.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifOutDiscards

description: The spanning tree topology has begun to change.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The spanning tree topology has stopped changing.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Sent whenever the number of hardware errors in received and
transmitted packets has exceeded the port's limit.

event.Summary: Received and transmitted packets hardware error limit exeeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxIfErrorsTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 RFC1213-MIB::ifInErrors c 9999 RFC1213-MIB::ifOutErrors c 9999

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The number of inbound packets that contained
errors preventing them from being deliverable to a
higher-layer protocol.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifInErrors

description: The number of outbound packets that could not be
transmitted because of errors.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifOutErrors

description: The spanning tree root bridge ID for the unit has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree root bridge ID changed to $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxStRootIDTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpDesignatedRoot s EXAMPLEE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The bridge identifier of the root of the spanning
tree, as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol
as executed by this node. This value is used as
the Root Identifier parameter in all Configuration
Bridge PDUs originated by this node.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpDesignatedRoot

description: The unit's spanning tree cost to the root bridge has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree cost to root bridge changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The cost of the path to the root as seen from
this bridge.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpRootCost

description: The unit's spanning tree root port has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree root port changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The port number of the port that offers the lowest
cost path from this bridge to the root bridge.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpRootPort

description: The unit's spanning tree maximum age has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree maximum age changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The maximum age of Spanning Tree Protocol information
learned from the network on any port before it is
discarded, in units of hundredths of a second. This is
the actual value that this bridge is currently using.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpMaxAge

description: The unit's spanning tree hello time has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree hello timer changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The amount of time between the transmission of
Configuration bridge PDUs by this node on any port when
it is the root of the spanning tree, or trying to become
so, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the
actual value that this bridge is currently using.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpHelloTime

description: The unit's spanning tree forward delay time has changed.

event.Summary: Spanning tree forward delay timer changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: This time value, measured in units of hundredths of a
second, controls how fast a port changes its spanning
state when moving towards the Forwarding state. The
value determines how long the port stays in each of the
Listening and Learning states, which precede the
Forwarding state. This value is also used when a
topology change has been detected and is underway, to
age all dynamic entries in the Forwarding Database.
[Note that this value is the one that this bridge is
currently using, in contrast to
dot1dStpBridgeForwardDelay, which is the value that this
bridge and all others would start using if/when this
bridge were to become the root.]
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpForwardDelay

description: The Root Bridge ID in received Spanning Tree Configuration BPDUs
from the port has changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxStDesigRootTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedRoot s EXAMPLEE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The unique Bridge Identifier of the Bridge
recorded as the Root in the Configuration BPDUs
transmitted by the Designated Bridge for the
segment to which the port is attached.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedRoot

description: The bridge ID of the spanning tree designated bridge of the LAN/WAN
to which the port is attached has changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxStPortDesigBridgeTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedBridge s EXAMPLEE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The Bridge Identifier of the bridge that this
port considers to be the Designated Bridge for
this port's segment.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedBridge

description: The cost to the spanning tree root bridge from the designated port of
the LAN/WAN to which the port is attached has changed.

event.Summary: Cost from the designated port to spanning tree root bridge changed to $v2

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The path cost of the Designated Port of the segment
connected to this port. This value is compared to the
Root Path Cost field in received bridge PDUs.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedCost

description: The port ID of the spanning tree designated port of the LAN/WAN
to which the port is attached has changed.

event.Summary: Designated bridge port ID changed to $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxStPortDesigPortTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedPort s EX

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The Port Identifier of the port on the Designated
Bridge for this port's segment.
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortDesignatedPort

description: The spanning tree state of the port has changed.
A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: The port's current state, as defined by application of
the Spanning Tree Protocol. This state controls what
action a port takes on reception of a frame. If the
bridge has detected a port that is malfunctioning, it
will place that port into the broken(6) state. For
ports that are disabled (see dot1dStpPortEnable), this
object will have a value of disabled(1).
variables.name: BRIDGE-MIB::dot1dStpPortState

description: Sent whenever the unit's diagnostics have indicated an error.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CT-ELS10-MIB::lxhwDiagTrap CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity i 1 CT-ELS10-MIB::lxhwDiagCode s EXAMPLE

description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the
trap.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxtrapSeverity

description: Additoinal diagnostics information concerning
the slot's module.
variables.name: CT-ELS10-MIB::lxhwDiagCode
